member.name: T:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton
member.summary: The set of flags of all possible dialog box buttons.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.Ok
member.summary: The dialog box shows an `Ok` button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.Yes
member.summary: The dialog box shows a `Yes` button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.No
member.summary: The dialog box shows a `No` button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.Close
member.summary: The dialog box shows a `Close` button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.Cancel
member.summary: The dialog box shows a `Cancel` button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.OkClose
member.summary: The dialog box shows `Ok` and `Close` buttons.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.OkCancel
member.summary: The dialog box shows `Ok` and `Cancel` buttons.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.YesNo
member.summary: The dialog box shows `Yes` and `No` buttons.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton.YesNoCancel
member.summary: The dialog box shows `Yes`, `No` and `Cancel` buttons.

member.name: T:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption
member.summary: The model for customizing the dialog box.
member.remarks: With this model it becomes possible to change for example a particular button label. Additionally, it becomes possible to change the button's default behaviour.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.DefaultButtonOk
member.summary: This field represents the configuration of button `OK` as default button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.DefaultButtonYes
member.summary: This field represents the configuration of button `Yes` as default button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.DefaultButtonNo
member.summary: This field represents the configuration of button `No` as default button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.DefaultButtonClose
member.summary: This field represents the configuration of button `Close` as default button.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.DefaultButtonCancel
member.summary: This field represents the configuration of button `Cancel` as default button.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor.
member.remarks: This constructor uses button `OK` as assigned button.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.#ctor(Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton)
member.summary: The constructor to apply provided .
member.remarks: The provided button's default behaviour is disabled.
member.param: The button to be used.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.#ctor(Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The constructor to apply provided .
member.remarks: The provided button's default behaviour is applied according value of .
member.param: The button to be used.
True to enable default behaviour and false to disable it.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.#ctor(Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton,System.String)
member.summary: The constructor to apply provided .
member.remarks: The button's default label is replaced by provided .
member.param: The button to be used.
The label to be used.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.#ctor(Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogButton,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The constructor to apply provided .
member.remarks: The provided button's default behaviour is applied according value of as well as its default label is replaced by provided .
member.param: The button to be used.
The label to be used.
True to enable default behaviour and false to disable it.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.Button
member.summary: Gets and sets the corresponding button flag.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if provided value consists of more that one single button flag.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.Label
member.summary: Gets and sets the corresponding button label.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if provided value is invalid.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogOption.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets and sets the button's default behaviour.

member.name: T:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogResult
member.summary: The enumeration of all possible dialog box results.

member.summary: The message box returns no result.

member.summary: The result value of the message box is OK.

member.summary: The result value of the message box is Cancel.

member.summary: The result value of the message box is Yes.

member.name: F:Plexdata.Dialogs.DialogResult.No
member.summary: The result value of the message box is No.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.Internal.DialogBox.OkButtonCancel
member.summary: Gets the cancel behaviour of button `OK`. This property always returns false.
member.remarks: This property should not be used directly.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.Internal.DialogBox.CancelButtonCancel
member.summary: Gets the cancel behaviour of button `Cancel`. This property returns true if `Cancel` button is visible.
member.remarks: This property should not be used directly.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.Internal.DialogBox.CloseButtonCancel
member.summary: Gets the cancel behaviour of button `Close`. This property returns true if `Close` button is visible and the `Cancel` button is invisible.
member.remarks: This property should not be used directly.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.Internal.DialogBox.YesButtonCancel
member.summary: Gets the cancel behaviour of button `Yes`. This property always returns false.
member.remarks: This property should not be used directly.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.Internal.DialogBox.NoButtonCancel
member.summary: Gets the cancel behaviour of button `No`. This property returns true if the `No` button is visible, and the `Cancel` button as well as the `Close` button are both invisible.
member.remarks: This property should not be used directly.

member.name: P:Plexdata.Dialogs.Internal.DialogBox.CopyClipboardLabel
member.summary: Gets the label of copy clipboard link.
member.remarks: This property should not be used directly.

member.name: T:Plexdata.Dialogs.Native.WindowButtonHelper
member.summary: The static helper class to allow the modification of the window button `Minimize` and `Maximize`.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.Native.WindowButtonHelper.SetAdditionalButtons(System.Windows.Window,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the `Minimize` and `Maximize` buttons for provided window.
member.param: The window to modify those buttons for.
True to disable those buttons and false to enable them.
member.returns: True it the Win32 API call was successful and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.Native.WindowButtonHelper.SetMinimizeButton(System.Windows.Window,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the `Minimize` button for provided window.
member.param: The window to modify this button for.
True to disable this button and false to enable it.
member.returns: True it the Win32 API call was successful and false otherwise.

member.name: T:Plexdata.Dialogs.OpenFolderDialog
member.summary: The static class to allow a simple access to the open folder dialog.

member.name: M:Plexdata.Dialogs.OpenFolderDialog.Show
member.summary: Just shows the open folder dialog with default settings.
member.remarks: No additional message is shown, the initial folder is not set and the dialog caption is set to `Open Folder`. Furthermore, the dialog window is centered on screen.
member.returns: The information of selected directory or null in case of cancellation.
